entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 5.13.25
entry.summary: Live from Salem, State Senator David Brock Smith talks about legislation considered by lawmakers in the past week, plus details about other proposals to be considered between now and the end of the session, which is 49 days away.

entry.title: SUTHERLIN POLICE JAIL WOMAN FOR UNLAWFUL ENTRY/HARASSMENT
entry.summary: May 12, 2025 11:10 a.m. Sutherlin Police jailed a woman following an incident Saturday afternoon. An SPD report said at 12:40 p.m. the 54-year-old allegedly reached through a victim’s vehicle window at Triangle Park and slapped her, knocking off the victim’s glasses. She was charged with unlawful entry into a motor vehicle and harassment. She...

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 5.12.25
entry.summary: YMCA of Douglas County Sports Director Jen Edgar was in studio with Coach Miles Hayes on the phone to talk about basketball clinics that will be taking place June 30th through July 2nd.

entry.title: North Douglas High School career fair connects students with job opportunities
entry.summary: On Thursday, students from Elkton, Drain and Cottage Grove connected with local businesses and scouted potential careers at the North Douglas High School Career Fair.

entry.title: Douglas County Compensation Committee recommends salary increases for county officials
entry.summary: Douglas County is currently undergoing the annual process of settling on a budget for the upcoming fiscal year, as the 2024-25 fiscal year is set to end on July 1.

entry.title: May 12, 2025
entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: PEACE OFFICER MEMORIAL CEREMONY TO BE HELD THIS THURSDAY
entry.summary: May 12, 2025 3:40 a.m. In 1962, President John F. Kennedy signed a proclamation designating every May 15th as Peace Officer Memorial Day, and the week in which it falls as National Police Week. The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office will host a local Peace Officer Memorial Ceremony on the front lawn of the courthouse...

entry.title: CITY COUNCIL TO CONSIDER ORDINANCE PROHIBITING NEEDLE DISTRIBUTION
entry.summary: May 12, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Roseburg City Council will consider an ordinance prohibiting the distribution of hypodermic needles on city property, including parks and public ways, at its meeting on Monday night. The council and staff had a discussion about hypodermic needles at its April 21st meeting. Park employees regularly inspect spaces for needles...

entry.title: AIRPORT TAXIWAY EXPANSION IS UNDERWAY
entry.summary: May 12, 2025 3:20 a.m. A $2.5 million project to extend a key taxiway at the Roseburg Regional Airport is underway. A city release said the work is making a dream of airport expansion and safety improvement a reality. The useable part of the runway is temporarily shortened with a “reduced declared distance” and will...

entry.title: TIMBER GROUP TO HEAR PRESENTATION ON FIRE SEASON OUTLOOK

entry.title: UCC’S CONCERT BAND PERFORMS “STATE OF MIND”
entry.summary: May 12, 2025 2:50 a.m. In the KQEN Cultural Spotlight; The Umpqua Community College Performing and Visual Arts presents UCC’s Concert Band performing in “State of Mind” on June 4th at 7:00 p.m. at the Jacoby Auditorium on the UCC campus. entry.title: BARREL GROUND AND WILSON CREEK FIRES IN FINAL MOP-UP
entry.summary: May 11, 2025 3:00 p.m. The Barrel Ground and Wilson Creek fires were both in final mop-up as of Saturday evening. Douglas Forest Protective Association Business Manager Jill Miller said the Barrel Ground Fire, northeast of Yoncalla, was initially reported late Wednesday morning and was mapped at 36 acres. Mop-up began on Thursday....

entry.title: DFPA RESPONDS TO WILSON CREEK FIRE

entry.title: NEARLY 4 PERENT OF DOUGLAS COUNTY BALLOTS RECEIVED
entry.summary: May 10, 2025 7:00 a.m. Nearly 4 percent of ballots have been received for 2025 Douglas County May Special Districts Election as of Friday afternoon. Douglas County Clerk Daniel Loomis said 3.91 percent, or 3,470 ballots, have been returned. Loomis said that lags 2.99 percent behind the participation rate for the same point in the...
